member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.AngularUnit.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.AngularUnit.Radians
member.summary: Gets or sets the constant to multiply against this unit to get radians.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Projection.AuxiliarySphereType.SemimajorAxis
member.summary: Use semimajor axis or radius of the geographic coordinate system

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Projection.AuxiliarySphereType.AuthalicWithConvertedLatitudes
member.summary: Use authalic radius and convert geodetic latitudes to authalic latitudes

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Projection.AuxiliarySphereType.NotSpecified
member.summary: This indicates that this parameter should not appear in the projection string.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Datum.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the datum defining the spherical characteristics of the model of the earth

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Datum.Spheroid
member.summary: The spheroid of the earth, defining the maximal radius and the flattening factor

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Datum.ToWGS84
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of double parameters, (this can either be 3 or 7 parameters) used to transform this

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Datum.DatumType
member.summary: Gets or sets the datum type, which clarifies how to perform transforms to WGS84

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Datum.NadGrids
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of string nadGrid

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Projection.DatumType.Unknown
member.summary: The datum type is not with a well defined ellips or grid-shift

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Projection.DatumType.Param3
member.summary: The datum transform to WGS84 can be defined using 3 double parameters

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Projection.DatumType.Param7
member.summary: The datum transform to WGS84 can be defined using 7 double parameters

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Projection.DatumType.GridShift
member.summary: The transform requires a special nad gridshift

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Projection.DatumType.WGS84
member.summary: The datum is already the WGS84 datum

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.GeographicInfo.Datum
member.summary: Gets or sets the datum eg: D_WGS_1984

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.GeographicInfo.Meridian
member.summary: Gets or sets the prime meridian longitude of the 0 mark, relative to Greenwitch

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.GeographicInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the geographic coordinate system name eg: GCS_WGS_1984

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.LinearUnit.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.LinearUnit.Meters
member.summary: Gets or sets the constant to multiply with maps distances to get the distances in meters

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Meridian.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the string name

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Meridian.Longitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the longitude where the prime meridian for this geographic coordinate occurs.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the athority, for example EPSG

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.AuthorityCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the athority code.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.AuxiliarySphereType
member.summary: Gets or sets the auxiliary sphere type.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.CentralMeridian
member.summary: The horizontal 0 point in geographic terms

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.FalseEasting
member.summary: The false easting for this coordinate system

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.FalseNorthing
member.summary: The false northing for this coordinate system

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.Geoc
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean indicating a geocentric latitude parameter

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.IsGeocentric
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that indicates whether or not this projection is geocentric.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.IsLatLon
member.summary: True if this coordinate system is expressed only using geographic coordinates

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.IsSouth
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean indicating whether this projection applies to the southern coordinate system or not.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.IsValid
member.summary: True if the transform is defined. That doesn't really mean it accurately represents the named projection, but rather it won't throw a null exception during transformation for the lack of a transform definition.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.LatitudeOfOrigin
member.summary: The zero point in geographic terms

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.LongitudeOfCenter
member.summary: The longitude of center for this coordinate system

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this projection information

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.NoDefs
member.summary: A boolean that indicates whether to use the /usr/share/proj/proj_def.dat defaults file (proj4 parameter "no_defs").

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.Over
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean for the over-ranging flag

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.ScaleFactor
member.summary: The scale factor for this coordinate system

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.StandardParallel1
member.summary: The line of latitude where the scale information is preserved.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.Unit
member.summary: The unit being used for measurements.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.Zone
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer zone parameter if it is specified.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.alpha
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha/ azimuth.
member.value: ? Used with Oblique Mercator and possibly a few others. For our purposes this is exactly the same as azimuth

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.mGeneral
member.summary: Gets or sets the m. Named mGeneral to prevent CLS conflicts.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.no_rot
member.value: The no_rot. Seems to be used as a boolean.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.no_uoff
member.value: The no_uoff. Seems to be used as a boolean.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.rot_conv
member.value: The rot_conv. Seems to be used as a boolean.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo.to_meter
member.value: Multiplier to convert map units to 1.0m

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Spheroid.InverseFlattening
member.summary: Sets the value by using the current semi-major axis (Equatorial Radius) in order to calculate the semi-minor axis (Polar Radius).

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Spheroid.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the string name of the spheroid. e.g.: WGS_1984

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Spheroid.EquatorialRadius
member.summary: A spheroid is a pole flattened (oblate) sphere, with the radii of two axes being equal and longer than the third. This is the radial measure of one of these major axes in meters. e.g. 6, 378, 137 for WGS 84

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Projection.Spheroid.PolarRadius
member.summary: A spheroid is a pole flattened (oblate) sphere, with the radii of two axes being equal and longer than the third. This is the radial measure of the smaller polar axis in meters. One option is to specify this directly, but it can also be calculated using the major axis and the flattening factor.
